title: Inquiry-Based Biology Concept Development Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic biology terminology and observational experience of biological phenomena
context.additional_context: Concept mapping and feedback system operation using digital devices: measuring conceptual understanding through summative assessments

learning_goals: Learners can identify five core concepts explaining biological phenomena through inquiry-based activities.
Learners can refine causal relationships between concepts through iterative explanatory revisions over three or more stages.
Learners can self-assess their learning progress using a Concept Development Map (RMCC) with peer feedback and instructor guidance.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
